Question: So tell me what exactly is Spring Boot and why people prefer it
Answer: Spring Boot is built on top of Spring and it makes application development faster by reducing configuration and setup work

Question: Before Spring Boot what problem developers were facing
Answer: They had to write lot of configuration and setup manually which was time consuming

Question: What does auto configuration mean in Spring Boot
Answer: Auto configuration means Spring Boot automatically configures things based on libraries present in project

Question: What is starter dependency in Spring Boot
Answer: Starter is a group of dependencies that we add to get everything needed for a feature

Question: Why people say Spring Boot reduces boilerplate code
Answer: Because it provides default configuration and embedded server and simple setup

Question: What is embedded server in Spring Boot
Answer: Embedded server means Tomcat or similar server comes inside application and we do not need to deploy separately

Question: How do you usually run Spring Boot application
Answer: We run it using main method or using mvn spring boot run

Question: What is application properties file used for
Answer: It is used to write configuration like port number and database details

Question: What is difference between Spring and Spring Boot
Answer: Spring Boot removes manual configuration and makes Spring easier to use

Question: What is @SpringBootApplication annotation
Answer: It is a combination of configuration component scan and auto configuration

Question: Why Spring Boot is good for microservices
Answer: Because it is lightweight easy to start and has embedded server

Question: What is actuator in Spring Boot
Answer: Actuator provides endpoints to monitor and manage application

Question: What is default port of Spring Boot application
Answer: Default port is 8080

Question: How do you change port in Spring Boot
Answer: We change it in application properties file

Question: What is fat jar in Spring Boot
Answer: Fat jar is a jar file that contains application code and all dependencies and server

Question: Explain this code @SpringBootApplication public class App { public static void main(String[] args){ SpringApplication.run(App.class args); } }
Answer: This code starts Spring Boot application and creates Spring container

Question: What will happen if you run this main method
Answer: Application will start and embedded server will also start

Question: Explain this code @RestController public class Test { @GetMapping(hello) public String test(){ return hi; } }
Answer: This will create a REST endpoint and when we open hello in browser it will return hi

Question: What will happen in this code server.port=9090 in application properties
Answer: Application will start on port 9090 instead of 8080

Question: Explain this code @SpringBootApplication @ComponentScan(basePackages=com.app)
Answer: Spring Boot will scan only this package for components

Question: What will this code do @SpringBootApplication(exclude=DataSourceAutoConfiguration.class)
Answer: It will disable database auto configuration

Question: Explain this code SpringApplication.run(App.class args)
Answer: It will bootstrap the application and start Spring context

Question: What will happen if application properties file is missing
Answer: Application will still start using default values

Question: Explain this code @Value(${server.port}) private int port
Answer: Spring will inject port value from properties file into this variable

Question: What will happen if two controllers have same URL mapping
Answer: Application will fail at startup because of ambiguous mapping

Question: In real projects how do you manage different environments like dev and prod in Spring Boot
Answer: We use profiles and different properties files so each environment can have its own configuration

Question: What is Spring Boot profile and why it is important
Answer: Profile helps us load different beans and configuration based on environment

Question: How do you activate a specific profile in application
Answer: We can activate profile using properties file or command line argument

Question: What happens if no profile is active in Spring Boot
Answer: Default configuration is used

Question: How do you configure database in Spring Boot
Answer: We write database details in application properties and Spring Boot auto configures datasource

Question: What is connection pooling and why it matters
Answer: Connection pooling reuses database connections and improves performance

Question: How does Spring Boot decide which beans to auto configure
Answer: It checks classpath and configuration and then applies conditions

Question: What is condition annotation used for
Answer: It is used to load bean only when certain condition is true

Question: What is difference between application properties and application yml
Answer: Both are used for configuration but yml is more structured and readable

Question: How do you handle exceptions globally in Spring Boot
Answer: We use controller advice to catch and handle exceptions in one place

Question: What is actuator and how do you use it in real projects
Answer: Actuator is used to monitor application health metrics and other info

Question: How do you enable logging and change log level in Spring Boot
Answer: We configure it in application properties file

Question: What is devtools and why it is useful
Answer: Devtools helps in auto restart and faster development

Question: How do you secure sensitive values like passwords in properties
Answer: We use environment variables or external config and do not hardcode them

Question: What is difference between @RestController and @Controller in Spring Boot
Answer: @RestController directly returns response body while @Controller returns view name

Question: Explain this code @Profile(dev) @Component class A {}
Answer: This bean will only be loaded when dev profile is active

Question: What will happen in this code spring.profiles.active=prod in properties
Answer: Spring Boot will load prod configuration

Question: Explain this code @ConfigurationProperties(prefix=db)
Answer: Spring will bind properties starting with db to this class fields

Question: What will happen in this code @ConditionalOnProperty(name=feature.enabled havingValue=true)
Answer: Bean will be loaded only if property is true

Question: Explain this code @RestControllerAdvice class GlobalHandler {}
Answer: This class will handle exceptions globally for controllers

Question: What will this code do logging.level.root=DEBUG
Answer: It will set log level to debug for whole application

Question: Explain this code @EnableAutoConfiguration(exclude=SecurityAutoConfiguration.class)
Answer: It will disable security auto configuration

Question: What will happen in this code spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl auto=update
Answer: It will automatically update database schema based on entities

Question: Explain this code @Value(${my.app.name}) private String name
Answer: Spring will inject value from properties file into this field

Question: What will happen if database properties are wrong
Answer: Application will fail at startup because datasource cannot be created

Question: Your Spring Boot application is starting very slowly so how will you analyze it
Answer: First I will enable startup logs and actuator and check which beans are taking long time to initialize

Question: How do you debug auto configuration issues in Spring Boot
Answer: We enable debug mode and check auto configuration report to see what is getting applied

Question: Your application works locally but fails in server so how will you approach this
Answer: First I will check profiles environment variables and configuration differences

Question: What happens internally when Spring Boot application starts
Answer: It creates application context loads auto configuration scans components creates beans and then starts embedded server

Question: How do you reduce memory usage of Spring Boot application
Answer: We reduce object creation disable unused auto configs and tune JVM options

Question: What is difference between embedded server and external server in real deployment
Answer: Embedded server runs inside app while external server needs separate deployment and management

Question: How do you design Spring Boot application for high traffic
Answer: We use proper caching connection pooling async processing and scale horizontally

Question: How do you monitor Spring Boot application in production
Answer: We use actuator metrics logs and external monitoring tools

Question: Your service sometimes gives slow response but CPU is fine so what will you check
Answer: I will check database calls external API calls and thread blocking issues

Question: What is graceful shutdown and why it is important
Answer: Graceful shutdown allows running requests to complete before application stops

Question: How do you handle configuration in container based deployment
Answer: We use environment variables and external config instead of hardcoding

Question: What is difference between reactive and normal Spring Boot
Answer: Reactive is non blocking and uses event driven model while normal is thread per request

Question: When should you choose reactive approach
Answer: When handling large number of concurrent requests with IO heavy operations

Question: How do you handle versioning of REST APIs in Spring Boot
Answer: We use URL versioning or header based versioning to manage changes

Question: What is blue green deployment and how Spring Boot fits into it
Answer: It is deployment strategy where we switch traffic between two versions and Spring Boot works well due to fast startup

Question: Explain this code spring.main.lazy initialization=true
Answer: This will delay bean creation until they are actually needed

Question: What will happen in this code management.endpoints.web.exposure.include=health info metrics
Answer: It will expose these actuator endpoints

Question: Explain this code @ConditionalOnMissingBean class A {}
Answer: Spring will create this bean only if no other bean of this type exists

Question: What will happen in this code @SpringBootApplication(excludeName=org.example.SomeAutoConfig)
Answer: That auto configuration will be skipped during startup

Question: Explain this code server.shutdown=graceful
Answer: Application will wait for ongoing requests to finish before stopping

Question: What will happen in this code spring.datasource.hikari.maximum pool size=50
Answer: It will set maximum database connection pool size to 50

Question: Explain this code @EnableCaching
Answer: It will enable caching support in application

Question: What will happen in this code @Async on a method
Answer: Method will run in separate thread and return immediately

Question: Explain this code @Scheduled(fixedRate=5000)
Answer: This method will run every five seconds

Question: What will happen if actuator endpoints are exposed without security
Answer: It can leak sensitive information and is security risk
